alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 01 at 9:33AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 926 AM HST, radar indicated heavy showers and thunderstorms over western and northern portions of Kauai. Rain is falling at rates up to 2 inches per hour and is heaviest over western Kauai. Rainfall intensity within the remainder of the advisory area is expected to increase during the morning. Localized rain rates up to 3 inches per hour will be possible with the strongest thunderstorms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kapaa, Kekaha, Princeville, Kilauea, Kokee State Park, Wainiha, Na Pali State Park, North Fork Wailua Trails, Hanalei, Haena, Wailua Homesteads, Waimea, Polihale, Wailua, Moloaa, Mana, Barking Sands, Anahola, Waimea Canyon State Park and Kalihiwai. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1230 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
